intro: Apinagia tenuifolia, commonly known as the slenderleaf apinagia, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Apinagia tenuifolia is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
